Background Colours

Like text colours, background colours can be applied to any valid html element using the class: bg-x. Where x is replaced with the desired colour.

The colours available to choose from depend on the colours module, and any customisation that has been applied.

.bg-x
.bg-wht
.bg-white
.bg-cream
.bg-light
.bg-grey
.bg-dark
.bg-pitch
.bg-black
.bg-blk
.bg-silver
.bg-gold
.bg-yellow
.bg-orange
.bg-red
.bg-pink
.bg-violet
.bg-purple
.bg-blue
.bg-teal
.bg-mint
.bg-green

Usage example

<body class="bg-white">
  has a white background.
</body>

Media Queries

No media query support for this property. It might not be necessary to supply different values at different breakpoints. Please refer to (the media-query documentation) for more info.

Customising

Default Classes

The background colours are prefixed with bg- by default, but this can be changed with the $background-color-prop variable.

// change the class prefix to .b-
$background-color-prop: "b";

Custom Background Colours

As with all colours, the backgrounds inherit the default $colors map. You may customise the colours used for backgrounds by supplying a $background-colors map instead.

// change the background colours to only gold and crimson.
$background-colors: (
  gold: #DAC36E,
  crimson: #C1001B
);

Combined

After changing the prefix property and the map of colours in the previous two customisations, we would end up with the following css.

/* would result in css like: */
.b-gold     { color: #DAC36E; }
.b-crimson  { color: #C1001B; }

view the source on github: /src/components/background/_color.scss
